Name: Ana Lucia de Mattos Barretto Villela
Regina de Camargo Pires Oliveira Dias
Evan Spiegel
What I Learned: Asked for what he wanted until he got a yes, Ask the people who could save him 20-30 years for work. Each Experience gave him new skills and gave him more confidence to get to yes. Used his network to catapult himself. Grew up a little bit, and did some introspection. "Its not about working harder. Its about working the system". But by making "jumpcuts" or shortcuts, you can sometimes make connections and open doors even without having them "naturally" in your life path.

Name: Bobby Murphy
What I Learned: Snapchat Humanizes Technology into more natural one- to - many experiences creating fleeting and ephermeral moments

Name: Mark Zuckerberg
What I Learned: The question isn't, 'What do we want to know about people?', It's, 'What do people want to tell about themselves?   ---- The Hacker Way is an approach to building that involves continuous improvement and iteration. Hackers believe that something can always be better, and that nothing is ever complete --- People don't care about what you say, they care about what you build.---- Advertising works most effectively when it's in line with what people are already trying to do

Name: Drew Houston
What I Learned: They say that you're the average of the five people you spend the most time with. Think about that for a minute: who would be in your circle of five? I have some good news: MIT is one of the best places in the world to start building that circle. If I hadn't come here, I wouldn't have met Adam, I wouldn't have met my amazing cofounder, Arash, and there would be no Dropbox. One thing I've learned is surrounding yourself with inspiring people is now just as important as being talented or working hard. Can you imagine if Michael Jordan hadn’t been in the NBA, if his circle of five had been a bunch of guys in Italy? Your circle pushes you to be better, just as Adam pushed me.

Name: Ben Silbermann
What I Learned: BE GREAT AT ONE THING THAT IS WORTHY OF SOMEONE'S TIME. THE FUTURE IS UNWRITTEN. DONT TAKE THINGS ON THEIR FACE. COMMITMENT MATTERS. running a startup is like going on a roadtrip in a shoddy car trying to get to a destination on imperfect maps and information, if you need to buy gas you can get help, but they may kick you out of the drivers seat.THERE ARE ALOT OF DIFFERENT WAYS TO SUCEED BECAUSE THERE ARE ALOT OF DIFFERENT PEOPLE IN THE WORLD. TRUST YOUR INSTINCT

Name: Jan Koum
What I Learned: BUILD A COMPANY THAT LASTS 100 YEARS. NO ADS. NO GAMES. NO GIMMICKS. Our focus keeps us small and keeps giving value to users. We believe that simplicity and utility are what drive our products. Jan and I are both utilitarian in nature. We want to build a product people can rely on. On the internet there is a lot of flash and fad. What we are trying to build here is a long-term persistent sustainability

Name: D. Leopoldo Del Pino y Calvo-Sotelo
Vinod Khosla
What I Learned: Get religion about what your definite desire is.
